questions.question: Cause---------        Effect:  Rob no longer cries

choices.answer: It won't bring his mom back.
His dad slaps him.
He opened his suitcase.
He is too tough to cry.

questions.question: How does Rob deal with his problems?

choices.answer: Talks to the counselor
Talks to Norton and Billy
Puts his feelings in his suitcase
Puts his feelings in a cabinet

questions.question: How does Rob feel when the principal gives him a note excusing him from school?

choices.answer: Anxious, he doesn't like to be absent.
Nervous, his dad will be angry.
Sad, he loves school.
Excited, he doesn't like school anyway.

questions.question: How did Sistine react when Rob told her he knew  where a tiger was?

choices.answer: She asked to see it.
She hit him and ran away.
She didn't believe him.
She said she was going to tell Willie May.

questions.question: What do Rob and Sistine have in common?

choices.answer: They're both from Lister, FL.
They are both named after famous churches.
They both keep  their feelings in their suitcases.
They both have a rash on their legs.

questions.question: How did Sistine get Rob to open up about his feelings?

choices.answer: Threaten to not be his friend.
Threaten to tell on him about the tiger.
Double dared him.
Told him she knew her dad wasn't coming back.

questions.question: Why did Rob and his dad move to Lister?

choices.answer: To save money
To be near family
To get away from people talking about Caroline
To live in a nicer house

questions.question: Why is it important for the reader to understand what happened to Willie May's parakeet?

choices.answer: Kids love animal stories
It relates to the tiger and Rob's feelings
To show Willie May is a prophetess
Because Rob loves to carve animal sculptures

questions.question: Why does Sistine want to free the tiger?

choices.answer: She relates to how it feels being trapped.
She wants it to live with the panthers.
She thinks they're almost extinct.
She wants to be mean to Rob.

questions.question: Why doesn't Rob want to free the tiger?

choices.answer: It will get hurt.
It will run away.
Then he'll have to deal with his feelings.
Then he'll have to tell his dad.

questions.question: Cause:  Rob's dad finds spoiled meat under Rob's bed.        Effect----------------

choices.answer: He makes a delicious dinner.
He wants to teach Beauchamp a lesson.
He grounds Rob for being untidy.
He wants to thank Beauchamp.

questions.question: What advice did Willie May give to Sistine?

choices.answer: Let the sadness rise up.
Move in with her dad.
Stop being bossy.
Be polite and respectful to adults.

questions.question: What did Rob tell Sistine that upset her and made her run off?

choices.answer: He would keep the tiger forever.
She has to stop wearing his clothes.
Her daddy wasn't coming back to get her.
To stop fighting at school.

questions.question: Rob finally decided to release the tiger because-----------.

choices.answer: Sistine paid him to.
of what Willie May said about letting it rise on up.
he was afraid of Beauchamp.
he wanted it to live with the panthers.

questions.question: What effects did releasing the tiger have on Rob?

choices.answer: His dad shot it and he had to open his suitcase.
The tiger wouldn't leave the cage and Sistine yelled.
Rob decided to let it go and they walked into the forest.
His dad shot it and then Willie May got mad.

questions.question: What is a theme of The Tiger Rising?

choices.answer: Slow and steady wins the race.
It's OK to be different.
Dealing with your feelings is bittersweet.
Always try your best.
